intro: Cyathula cylindrica, commonly known as the narrow-leaf watercress, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, cylindrical leaves and small, white or yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in wetland environments, such as marshes and along the edges of ponds. Cyathula cylindrica is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
